question: A wooden block of mass M lies on a rough floor. Another wooden block of the same mass is hanging from the point O through strings as shown in the figure.
images/e3b6a935-7d8b-4a3d-9c4e-123456789001_1.png
To achieve equilibrium, the co-efficient of static friction between the block on the floor with the floor itself is
explanation: T sin θ = Mg (Vertical component balances the hanging mass)
T cos θ = f = μN = μMg (Horizontal component balances friction)
μ = T cos θ / T sin θ = cot θ
